summary: Richard Ober was involved in the effort to create and distribute an Identi-Kit composite of James Earl Ray in April 1968. As part of CI/OP/DO, Ober requested the construction of the composite using a specific code and noted details about Ray's appearance. He also requested the distribution of photographs of Ray to various stations, indicating his role in disseminating information related to Ray.
significance: Richard Ober's significance lies in his role in the creation and distribution of materials related to James Earl Ray, the assassin of Martin Luther King Jr. The documents suggest his involvement in intelligence operations related to Ray shortly after King's assassination.
